result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Status conference on September 30, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.

Prosecuting attorney Timothy Robert Verhoff in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Will Rice Anderson for Atty. Stanley Woodard in court for Jerome L Clash. State requests counts 1,2 3 be found transactionally related.  No objection.  Court does find counts 1,2 and 3 are transactionally related. State calls City of Madison Police Officer H. Tank, sworn. Direct. Officer identifies defendant. Cross.  State moves for bind over, waives argument, saves for rebuttal.  Defense objects, argues.  Rebuttal by State. CT: finds probable cause, and does bind over.
Preliminary hearing on August 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

*IN CUSTODY*

Defendant Jerome L Clash in court. Attorney Tracey Lencioni for Stanley V. Woodard in court for Jerome L Clash.  Attorney Rebekah M Rennicke in court for State of Wisconsin. State requesting set over. TIME LIMITS HAVE NOT BEEN WAIVED. Court reschedules within time limits.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
